intro: Galium trichophorum, commonly known as the hairy bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium trichophorum is often found in moist, shaded areas such as woodlands and stream banks.
